description_of_incident: A group of 10-12 men disrupted a baptism ceremony in  Navjivan fellowship church. They were armed with cricket stumps and bats and left four people injured in the attack. A case of rioting was lodged in the Nashik Taluka Police Station.

Nearly two dozen members of Bajrang Dal stormed the Douglas Memorial Church in Savner, Maharashthra during the sunday morning prayer service. They were armed with stricks and continued to destroy several chairs and tables in the church.

A husband and wife committed suicide after the local village council, or panchayat, ordered them to annul their marriage or face death. Amreen was Muslim and her husband, Lokesh, a Hindu. The panchayat has beeen charged with abetment to suicide.

The Holy Family Church was desecrated in the early hours of the day, and the statue of Mother Mary was found broken to pieces. Though the police tried to link it with an attempt to burgle the donation box, members of the community disputed the police version.

St. Mathias Church was vandalised weeks after a church vandalism in Mysuru. Vandals forced opened the side doors of the church and took away vessels used for religious purposes and money kept in the donation box, besides damaging the tabernacle. Police officials were not clear on whether it was an attack on the church or a robbery. But members of the community described the incident as an "organised attack to humiliate the Christian community and create fear among them".
location: St. Mathias Church, Malavalli, Sultan Road

description_of_incident: Violence broke after an incident of alleged cow slaughter. A mob of nearly 4,000 people from local villages tried to torch two mosques and a madrassa, and vandalised shops owned by Muslims. A police officer sustained injuries when he was controlling the mob. No other casualty was reported. Police had earlier registered a case and arrested six locals, all belonging to the minority community, after a beheaded cow and its body parts packed in gunny sacks were found strewn across the forest of Pujarli vilage.
fir_details: Under Sections 147, 148 and 149 for rioting, Section 153 for hurting religious sentiments. Section 353 for assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty

description_of_incident: A group of people vandalised a church and assaulted the pastor, accusing him of carrying out forced conversions. Five people have been detained for attacking Dayalu Suna, the pastor, at the church. Police said the mob also tried to attack some students and a teacher of IIT Kanpur who had come to the church to attend a function, but were rescued by the timely intervention of police.

Activists of the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) attacked a church which was under construction, brought down its walls, broke doors and windows, resulting in partial collapse of its main structure, and installed an idol of Anjaneya Swamy at the altar of the church. VHP leaders alleged that the church was being constructed in a Hindu-majority area with the view to convert people.

A mob of Hindus attacked Muslims, forced around 400 of them to flee their houses, and set around 20 houses on fire over a dispute involving a 30-year-old mosque. Both Hindus and Muslims had claimed the land belonged to their respective communities. However, the court ruled in favour of the Muslims. The Hindus also objected because the mosque stood adjacent to a temple. In the ensuing attack, the Hindus attacked the community with bricks, swords, and petrol bombs.

A Christian professor, T J Joseph, was attacked and his hand severed off by Islamic extremists while returning home from Sunday mass along with his mother and sister. The assailants were outraged by a question paper he had set in his college, which they felt denigrated Islam.

In a planned attack on Muslim families in Udaipur following the murder of a person from the Meena community, at least 70 homes of Muslims residents were looted and set on fire. This was done by members of the Meena tribe, allegedly after being instigated by members of the Hindu Sangh Parivar, despite the police arresting the murder accused and the Muslim community ostracising them. The incident has reportedly left 500 Muslims homeless.

Pastor Jayaraj was attacked by a group of ten men close to midnight and asked to go slow on conversions. Jayaraj was hit on his head and nose, and had to undergo a series of surgeries. Jayaraj says he is so scared that he has drastically cut down on his preaching activity.
Angry villagers attacked, set afire and razed a factory, after reports spread that the premises was used for cow slaughter. Two houses of factory owners were also destroyed.
was_affiliated_with_org: Vishwa Hindu Parishad and the Gowshala Sangh

description_of_incident: Muslim residents of Aasind were to take out a procession on the occasion of Milad-un-Nabi. However, owing to an earlier confrontation, activists of the RSS and VHP had warned that they would not allow the procession to be taken out and had called for a bandh to be observed in the region. The RSS and VHP activists allegedly burnt down several shops owned by Muslims. No persons were reported injured. Police imposed curfew and arrested at least 60 persons for disturbing the peace.
was_affiliated_with_org: Vishwa Hindu Parishad, Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh

description_of_incident: A Muslim religious leader was killed by a group of people who objected to the contents of his speech that he had delivered in different gatherings in the past three days in the area. Maulana Ruhul Quddus, who was riding pillion on a bike, was allegedly stopped by half a dozen people who argued with Quddus. During the heated argument, one of them reportedly took out a gun and shot the Maulana.

A Hindu-Muslim couple was beaten up by relatives of the woman when the couple was travelling in a bus together. The woman's brother and his friends waylaid the bus, beat the man with sticks and dragged him to the police station. The woman was taken home, where she was beaten by her brother, her uncle and his son.

Rajesh Kataria, convener of the right-wing organisation Hindu Chetna Manch, was shot by three motorbike-borne Muslim youths. He was hit by one bullet. However, he did survive the attack. One of the attackers was a member of Ahl al-Suffah, a Ratlam-based Islamic proselytising and charity group that became active after Muzaffarnagar riots.

Communal riots were sparked after three Muslim youths confessed to slaughtering a cow and dumping its carcass near a place of Hindu worship. At least 45 people--including 25 police personnel--were injured.
cross_fir_details: Under Section 295 (hurting religious sentiments), and the relevant sections of the Prevention of Cow Slaughter Act.

description_of_incident: A pastor in Budvel was dragged out of his home and beaten up.

Christian pastor Moses and his wife Suvartha were assaulted by three activists of right-wing Hindu Vahini group who reportedly took offence to their converting the parents of one of the assailants. Moses's back has multiple stitches now while Suvartha took the blows on her skull, as a result of which she feels dizzy all the time.
Pastor of Ippathi church G Niladri Pal was attacked allegedly by Hindu Vahini activists
In December, pastor Talla Christopher was attacked by two persons

At around 8:30 pm, a group of men knocked on Pastor Sanjeevulu's door. They said they had come to offer prayers. When Pramila, the pastor's wife, opened the door, she was struck on the forehead with an iron rod. The assailants then marched into the house and stabbed the pastor, repeatedly. He was beaten with clubs and hit on the head with the iron rod. The attack barely lasted 10 minutes but Sanjeevulu sustained severe injuries to his liver, spleen and intestines. Three days later, he succumbed to his wounds at the Yashoda Hospital in Hyderabad.

Alleging conversion of poor Hindu people into Christianity, 50 activists of Bajrang Dal on Sunday reportedly attacked and vandalised a Christian prayer building. The incident created panic among the small Christian community of the district town.The group allegedly attacked some people and ransacked furniture.

After a religious flag, placed on a hillock occupied by Sikhs, was found burnt, a large number of Sikhs armed with swords, kirpans, and lathis went to Muslim-dominated Arsh Mahal area and confronted the residents. In the ensuing violence, 10 hourses and shops were burnt and several motorcycles, autorickshaws and cars were damaged. Five Muslims were wounded in these clashes.

A 24-year-old Muslim technology professional, Sheikh Mohsin, died of injuries after members of the radical right-wing outfit Hindu Rashtra Sena attacked him. The Pune police said Sheikh from Solapur was beaten to death when he was on his way home after evening prayers. The incident is a fallout of communal tensions in the city after morphed derogatory photos of Maratha king Shivaji and Shiv Sena chief Bal Thackeray were posted on Facebook.

When a bus travelling from Bhopal to Raisen reached its destination, Bajrang Dal leader Babu Chautaiya called his supporters and attacked Naved Khan, seriously injuring him. When Naved Khan's family reached City Kotwali police station, Bajrang Dal activists also assembled which led to sloganeering and sporadic clashes between two communities inside the station. Bajrang Dal activists later went on rampage ransacking several shops at Sabzi Mandi area of the town where eight shops were looted and six were put on fire; they also attacked vehicles parked at Maha Maya Chowk and bus stand and tried to torch a petrol bunk in the vicinity. The Jama Masjid of the Raisen town was also damaged in the clashes.

Bajrang Dal activists allegedly assaulted three students for watching a movie together. The attackers dragged the three students--two Muslim boys and a Christian girl--out of the theatre, abused and assaulted them while insulting their religion. The attackers also snatched their mobiles phones and took their pictures and uploaded them on Facebook. They are also accused of stealing private photos from their mobiles.

A stone pelted at a Ganesh procession led to communal violence between Hindus and Muslims. At least seven persons were injured, and a restaurant was set on fire. A roadside stall and some vehicles were also damaged.

Four Muslim students were beaten by residents of the Jat colony on accusations of eve teasing. Rumours of the death of one of the students led to further violence during which a Hindu man was shot at.

A Bajrang Dal leader Kapil Rathod and his domestic helper Pukhraj were shot dead by a group of Muslim youths. One of them was Hyder Sherani, whose uncle Yashmin Sherani was attacked by some unidentified persons two hours before Rathod and Pukhraj were shot dead.
Curfew was imposed following communal tensions after the chopped head of a cow was found near a temple. Angry protestors blocked traffic and torched vehicles.
A Navratri jagran arranged in front of a mosque led to communal tensions. Heated arguments between Hindu and Muslim communities led to stone pelting and burning of a shop.

Tension mounted after a former BJP MLA announced to build a temple near a mosque which saw communal clashes due to a Navratri jagran the previous day. Members of both communities started pelting stones on each other and opening gun fire. Fifteen people, including 13 policemen and two locals, have been injured.
Amidst communal tensions, stone pelting started afresh and gun fire was exchanged between Hindus and Muslims.

Communal clashes were sparked between Dalits and Muslims after a Muslim youth tried to stop a villager from beating a labourer. Both sides fired at each other, and the Muslim youth died of a bullet injury.
Dalits and Muslims clashed over sharing water from a hand-pump. At least six houses of both communities were set on fire by the rioters. Half-a-dozen people also sustained injuries.
Communal clashes rose after some people objected to dumping of construction material on the road. Two people were injured in the clash.

A fire broke out in a church in Northeast Delhi's Dilshad Garden. Police registered a case for arson following allegations by parish members that the fire was not accidental. The Delhi Archbishop alleged this to be the work of some communities looking to incite communal passions. He said that there was a strong smell of kerosene to the place, which could prove that it was "set on fire" rather than have caught it. No one was harmed in the incident.

Scrap dealer Ali Asgar Zaveri was forced to sell his bungalow barely a year after he bought it, following pressure from Hindu neighbours, Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) and the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS). VHP leader Pravin Togadia reportedly asked neighbours not to allow Zaveri to move in, and to attack the latter if he did not give up the bungalow within 48 hours.
was_affiliated_with_org: Vishwa Hindu Parishad, Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh

description_of_incident: Three persons were injured in clashes after a local signage of one community was damaged during a procession on the occasion of Eid-e-Milad. This resulted in stone pelting and chaos, but the police presence for the procession ensured that the situation was brought under control immediately. Police have been reported to have used at least 6 tear gas shells to disperse the crowd.

Communal tension occurred due a fight between a Muslim boy and a group of Hindu youths. The fight led to loss of property and destruction of shops in the locality. Next morning, a Hindu boy was assaulted leading to more tension.

Three men died and at least nine were injured in communal clashes between Hindus and Muslims. The trigger, reportedly, was the beating of a Muslim youth who caught a kite. Shops, a furniture godown, agriculture fields and homes were torched, and a mosque was damaged.

At least 30 people were injured and property worth lakhs destroyed in clashes after about 25,000 Hindus converged for a meeting. Muslims say Hindus started the attacks roused by inflammatory speeches made at the meeting. Hindus say Muslims waylaid activists returning from the meeting and attacked them.
was_affiliated_with_org: Bajrang Dal, Popular Front of India

description_of_incident: A mob of thousands of Hindus attacked the Azizpur village after the body of a 20-year-old Hindu boy, Bhartendu Sahni, was found in a Muslim man's field. At least five people were killed, several injured and many others reported missing. At least 40 homes were torched.
fir_details: Againt 2,000 people for arson and murder

description_of_incident: The body of 20-year-old Bhartendu Sahni was found in a Muslim man's field. Bhartendu was said to be in love with the man's daughter.

Jahangir, a 24-year-old Muslim youth, was assaulted by four Hindu youths, reportedly over a parking dispute. He was handed over to the police on accusation of chain snatching. Jahangir succumbed to his injuries the next morning. His family alleged police apathy in providing medical attention.

Members of a Muslim family were assualted--and their house ransacked--after a youth of the family had eloped with a Hindu girl. The girl's father filed a case of kidnapping against the youth, while the Muslim family fled the village fearing more attacks.
fir_details: Under Section 452 (house trespass after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint)
cross_fir_details: Under Sections 363/366 (kidnapping, abducting or inducing woman to compel her marriage, etc)

description_of_incident: A Muslim student was beaten by Hindu groups after he posted photos of his classmates with Hindu girls on social media. About 10 men landed up at the student's home, blindfolded him, beat him with sticks and kicked him.

Derogatory comments on Facebook about Prophet Mohammed and an "objectionable photograph of a place of worship of Muslims" led to communal flare-up. Muslims thrashed the boy. Police reached the spot and brought the situation under control.
cross_fir_details: Under relevant sections of the IT Act and Indian Penal Code

description_of_incident: An under-construction chruch was destroyed in Haryana by Hindu extremists, who alleged that the Christian priest was carrying out forced conversions. According to the priest, a month before, a group of people had disrupted prayers and "threatened him with dire consequences" if he failed to leave the village.
fir_details: For rioting, damaging a place of worship, theft and promoting enmity

description_of_incident: When a Hanuman Jayanti procession was passing by a local mosque, miscreants pelted stones at the procession. This led to violence, and a dozen of shops were set ablaze. Fifteen people were injured including three policemen.
A five-member team of Tablighi Jamaat, a Muslim organisation, was beaten up by some local youths, allegedly Jat, in a Delhi-Kandhla train on Friday near Baghpat.

In retaliation to the attack against a five-member team of Talbhigi Jamaat, the Muslim community indulged in violence, pelting stones on the police station and setting police vehicles on fire. A train was stopped in its tracks at the Kandhla station which gave rise to rumours of #GodhraAgain on social media.
fir_details: For violence at the station, and for arson at the police station

description_of_incident: Abdul Ghaffar Qureshi, 60, was lynched following rumours that Muslims had killed more than 200 cows for a feast. Pictures of carcasses started circulating on social media. Young men in thousands gathered in the fields of Kumhari village where the carcasses were lying. Incidentally, a municipality contractor had rented the field to dispose of cattle carcass as a routine exercise. Tension, however, spread and Qureshi was beaten with iron rods and killed in the market place, despite some of his Hindu neighbours trying to help him.

Two bottles filled with a mixture of petrol and diesel were found after the house of BJP national secretary H. Raja was attacked. Raja claimed that his outright condemnation of Muslim-orchestrated riots in Ambur was the immediate provocation.
party_in_power: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam

description_of_incident: Three suspected cattle thieves were beaten to death allegedly by villagers. Vehicle was also set on fire. Suspected thieves allegedly opened fire when villagers intercepted their vehicle, two fled.
cross_fir_details: FIR had been lodged by the villagers against the alleged smugglers under sections 382 (theft), 457 (trespass) and 307 (attempt to murder) of the IPC.

description_of_incident: Two days after Prime Minister Narendra Modi lashed out at cow protection groups, two Uttar Pradesh residents who were transporting cows were beaten by a mob and their vehicles set on fire in a Panipat village. Imrani Ali and Asheef Ali, residents of UP's Tanda village, were arrested following a case registered against them at Panipat's Model Town police station.

A Muslim man was stripped, tied to a pole and beaten by a mob in Karnataka's Mangalore, allegedly for speaking to a female Hindu colleague. The attackers paraded him through the crowded market area before tying him to an electricity pole. The images were circulated on WhatsApp. The beating continued for nearly an hour. The police arrived when the visuals were flashed on local cable channels. The mob allegedly also humiliated the young woman when she tried to stop the assault.

Cattle trader Ibrahim Padubidri was attacked by Bajrang Dal activists with metal rods and chains on a rumour about a stolen cow. Ibrahim had purchased three cows and two calves from farmers, whom the Bajrang Dal members berated for selling to a Muslim despite being Hindu farmers. The police arrested the Bajrang Dal members but the farmers were forced by the Bajrang Dal to file a case of theft against Ibrahim. He was arrested too and taken to the hospital.

Students of the Milad E Sherif Memorial College damaged Rahul Easwar's car as he did not support the beef festival when asked to. Students blocked his path and closed the college gate, shouted slogans, and waved black flags at him. At least 25 students attacked his car chanting anti-beef ban and pro-secularism slogans. A constable intervened. College principal Shaik Ahammed later apologised to him.

Independent legislator Engineer Rashid, who had served beef kebabs and patties on the lawns of the state legislators' hostel to oppose restrictions on cow slaughter, was beaten, kicked and punched by 6-8 BJP MLAs inside the Jammu and Kashmir assembly on Thursday.

Police had to resort to firing to control the mob that went on a rampage, burning vehicles and shops, after rumours that two butchers had been spotted slaughtering a cow spread. The mob also physically assaulted the butchers. Later, it was found that the cow had actually died the previous day and the butchers had a license to remove the skin and were hence doing their job.

Zahid Rasool Bhat, the 16-year-old conductor of a truck, was attacked by a mob with petrol bombs on the Jammu-Srinagar Highway. The truck was standing still near Shiv Nagar area as traffic was stopped in view of the day-long strike called by various Hindu outfits after three carcasses of cows were found. Bhat suffered severe burn injuries following the attack. He was brought to Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital, where he succumbed to burn injuries on the intervening night of October 17 and 18.

A 40-year-old man set himself ablaze inside a cow-shelter alleging that he was being harassed by employees of Bal Gopal Gaushala who objected to his selling cow fodder because he is Muslim. Eid Mohammad suffered 60% burns and was admitted to Guru Gobind Singh Medical College at Faridkot where his condition was stated to be critical, police said, adding one person has been arrested in this connection.

An angry mob bludgeoned to death 22-year-old Noman after stopping a truck with more than a dozen cows and oxen on board. Four of his associates were also beaten up before being taken into police custody on allegations of cow smuggling.
cross_fir_details: Under laws prohibiting cow slaughter and cruelty to animals

description_of_incident: Jammu and Kashmir independent MLA Sheikh Abdul Rashid, who was earlier thrashed for holding a beef party in Srinagar, was attacked with black ink in New Delhi.

Headmaster Md Hasmat Ali alias Babu, 55, was clobbered to death by a mob. Villagers had allegedly spotted him with a calf that went missing from one Khumallambam Brojen's shed. Ali's body was taken to the Jawaharlal Nehru Institute of Medical Sciences in the state capital for autopsy.

A truck carrying meat from Mewat to Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh via Palwal was intercepted by a large crowd. While the driver of the truck managed to flee, the helper was beaten by the mob. Palwal District Magistrate Ashok Kumar Meena said the violence continued for over five hours. It was later found that the meat in the truck was camel meat and not cow meat. Police had to call in reinforcements to curb the mob. The injured include at least five policemen and several members of the aggressive mob as well as the helper who was first beaten by the mob

An unidentified cow protection vigilante team shot dead a migrant worker. Unidentified people opened fire at a group of nearly 40 migrant workers who were heading from Nawanshahr in Punjab to their native place in Uttar Pradesh to cast vote in panchayat polls. The deceased, 25-year-old Khush Noor, is a native of Ballamajra village in Saharanpur. Another man, Ehsaan, suffered a minor injury.

Hindu right-wing activists belonging to a cow protection group allegedly assaulted a Muslim couple on a train in Madhya Pradesh on the suspicion of carrying beef, which was in fact buffalo meat found in another passenger's luggage. The couple was travelling from Khandwa to hometown Harda on the Kushinagar Express.

The police arrested four activists of the Bajrang Dal for allegedly setting fire to the Tipu Sultan cave in Karkala taluk in Karnataka. While Muslims consider it the Tipu Sultan cave, the Bajrang Dal is of the view that the cave belongs to Hindus and was known as Ambarisha cave historically.

A local mob attacked a Muslim cop and his Hindu colleague, and made the former walk around with a saffron flag, because the victims had reportedly told a group of local youth to not raise saffron flags in front of a mosque, as it could create tensions. The youth showed up at the police chowki with a mob of around 200-300 people from the village, alleging that the two policemen had crushed the saffron flags under their feet. While his colleague was able to escape the mob's fists and lathis, the Muslim cop was brutally beaten up. A video of the incident has been uploaded on social media.

A group of Muslim students were beaten up for not chanting the nationalist slogan 'Jai Mata Ki'. The assault has left one of the student's arm broken. According to Dilkash, he and his friends, Ajmal and Naeem, were walking through a park when they were assaulted. Mohammad Dilkash said, "We had gone to a park nearby. Some men came and slapped one of my friends, asked him to say 'Jai Mata Ki' and they said they would kill us if we don't say it. But we didn't say.
fir_details: For causing grevious hurt under sections 323, 325 and 341 and section 34 of the IPC.

description_of_incident: At least one person was killed after a mob allegedly attacked a police station and damaged vehicles in Illambazar and Dubrajpur areas following an "objectionable" post on a social networking website by a college student. People had gheraoed the house of the student Sujan Mukherjee on Monday night after he uploaded the post on Facebook, following which he fled, police said.
cross_fir_details: Under various sections of the IT Act and Indian Penal Code

description_of_incident: A group of more than 15 men allegedly vandalised a prayer hall that served as a church and manhandled the congregation inside. The incident happened at the time a prayer meeting was in progress. Locals said the men came on motorcycles and shouted slogans like "Jai Shri Ram" while alleging religious conversions.
Five Hindu fringe outfit members vandalised a church that was recently renovated as they were against its functioning as a Hindu temple was located nearby.
fir_details: Under Sections 295 (A) (deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs), 147 (rioting), 148 (rioting, armed with deadly weapons), 452 (house-trespass after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint) and 506 (ii) (criminal intimidation) of the Indian Penal Code and Section 3 of the Tamil Nadu Public Property (Prevention of Damage and Loss) Act.
party_in_power: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam

description_of_incident: Two Muslim cattle herders were hanged to death in a communally-sensitive region of Jharkhand. Five suspects, including a member of a local cow protection vigilante group, were arrested.

A Sikh man was attacked and two others were insulted during a protest blocking the Chandigarh highway. Following the death of Hindu Shiv Sena head Abhishek Batta in a road accident, Shiv Sena activists termed it a conspiracy as he was facing a threat to his life from militant groups. The Sikh man's turban was allegedly removed in the scuffle.

Six Muslim boys--all students of Class IX in a local school--were beaten, allegedly with sharp weapons, when they tried to watch Holi celebrations at the Thabal Chongba Ground. Locals suspected they had come there for anti-social activities.

Mustain Abbas and four others were on their way back to Saharanpur from Kurukshetra after buying a bull for ploughing the fields. A police vehicle and 10-12 armed men had blocked the road with tractors. The men opened fire, bursting the pickup van's tyres. Abbas was injured trying to flee, but the others managed to escape. Abbas' body was recovered on April 2.
Truck allegedly carrying buffalo tallow was stopped. Driver Balkar Singh thrashed; booked under cow slaughter law.

Three Manipuri Muslim youth were beaten up at Mayang Imphal Yangbi Garden for allegedly trying to steal a vehicle. The incident took place after these boys came out of the garden. Two of them died on the spot as a result of the beating while the third sustained serious injuries.

Unidentified men shouting "Jai Shri Ram" beat pastor Deenanath and his pregnant wife, doused them with petrol and tried to set them on fire. The two managed to escape when they screamed for help and other villagers rushed to the spot. The attackers allegedly destroyed the electronic equipment at the church besides attacking the pastor's children and setting ablaze scriptures and furniture.

Three people beat up Waseem, 20, in Sohna alleging he was carrying beef; a fourth person recorded the crime. Others threatened the victim with a gun. Later, vigilantes posed for photographs with the victim.

A truck-driver, carrying 22 cows in his vehicle, tried to take a detour to avoid a nearby police check point and fell into a nullah in the process. When the police tried to arrest the accused and take him away, an angry mob of locals refused to let him go, and clashed with the police and demanded that he be handed over to the locals. The mob also damaged vehicles and created a huge ruckus in the process.

A Muslim man--suspected to be a cattle smuggler--was killed in a shootout between cattle smugglers and cow vigilantes. The smugglers were in a mini truck, which was also carrying at least half a dozen cows.

Unidentified miscreants damaged the statue of St. Anthony placed at the compound entrance of the St. Anthony's Chapel at Kandlur village near Kundapur. According to the police, miscreants damaged the one-foot tall statue--kept in a glass covered from three sides. Fr. Vishal Lobo, parish priest of Basrur, said there has been no history of enmity between communities in Kandlur, and added that the damage "appears to be a deliberate act, as the miscreants have not touched the nearby donation box".

A Muslim couple was beaten up by members of the Bajrang Dal who mistook the woman to be a Hindu and the case to be one of 'Love Jihad'. The woman also accused the attackers of gang raping her. The woman and her Muslim friend had gone out to eat Pizza, when they were accosted by the goons. They hurled communal abuses at the couple and said, "Tum log Hindu mohalle ko ganda karte ho (You lot are dirtying the Hindu locality)". They then dragged them out of the place, beat them, and then took her to another place where she was gang-raped.

Two men transporting beef in a car were beaten and forced to eat 'panchagavya'--a concoction of cow dung, cow urine, milk, curd and ghee. The Muslim men--Rizwan and Muktihar--were later handed over to the police. They were arrested under Prohibition of Cow Slaughter Act.
fir_details: Under section 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 365 (kidnapping), 295 A (outraging religious feelings) and 506 (criminal intimidation)
cross_fir_details: Under Prohibition of Cow Slaughter Act

description_of_incident: A 14-year-old Muslim boy, Ershad, was killed for having an affair with his neighbor, a 15-year-old Hindu girl. Two brothers of the girl and an uncle has been arrested by the police, who said that the boy was quietly abducted, killed and buried. Police dug out his body from the compound of the girl's family.

Two women had been detained by police for allegedly smuggling 30 kg of meat. Veterinary tests showed the meat was from a buffalo. The women were slapped, kicked and abused by a mob for 30 minutes while police made feeble attempts to control the crowd; one woman collapsed.
Communal tensions rose after a house, where a cow was allegedly slaughtered, was attacked by a mob.

Ilyas Shaikh, a tempo driver, was beaten by a group of 10 alleged cow vigilantes after the latter found cow skin and bones in the tempo. Shaikh told police that he has signed a contract with Surat Municipal Corporation to transport dead animal skin and bones from the waste disposal site at Khajod to Chhota Udepur. He also showed the necessary papers to the police.

Cow vigilantes attacked two Muslim youths and a pickup van driver while they were transporting calves. Police said that around 30 youths intercepted the vehicle and after dumping the calves, beat up the driver and the two youths who were in the vehicle.

P A Basheer, a 36-year-old native of Kondageri village in Madikeri district, was assaulted by a group of 20 cow vigilantes while he was returning with two oxen from Koggodu village, 12 km away from his village. They alleged that he had stolen the cattle. Basheer said it was through a broker that he had finalised the deal to purchase two oxen for Rs 17,500. Basheer's friend, Salaam, who was travelling with him, managed to escape.

On the intervening night of August 24-25, some people entered a house in the Muslim-dominated region of Mewat, where a 20-year-old woman and her 14-year old cousin was sexually assaulted by attackers inside their home. Their uncle and aunt were beaten to death the same night. An NDTV report said that the victim narrated the incident in presence of activist Shabnam Hashmi in New Delhi. "They asked if we eat beef. We said that we don't, but they said that was why (we were being punished)," the woman was quoted as saying.
religion_of_victim_1: Identity witheld for sexual assault case
religion_of_victim_2: Identity witheld for sexual assault case
religion_of_victim_3: Identity witheld for sexual assault case
religion_of_other_victim: Identity witheld for sexual assault case

description_of_incident: Decomposed bodies of a Hindu man (Vijay, 30) and his 9-month pregnant Muslim wife (Sufia alis Priya, 22) were found. Police arrested Shafiq Mansoori, a friend of Vijay and a distant relative of Priya, as villagers harassed him for the being the reason behind their interfaith marriage.

A man and his associate driving a truck with a cow and a calf had an accident. The calf died. Also injured in the accident, Mohammed Ayyub tried to flee the spot but was chased by a group of men and beaten up by suspected cow vigilantes, police said. His associate Sameer Sheikh, however, was saved by a policeman who was on duty nearby. Ayyub succumbed to his injuries at the hospital.

Despite permission from the police to avoid confusion over the sacrifice of buffaloes on Eid-al-Adha, two men were beaten up allegedly by a group of cow vigilantes a day after Eid in outer Delhi's Kirari village. The men were on their way to dump the remains of animals, sacrificed in their madrasa in outer Delhi.

A 24-year-old man was allegedly assaulted by members of "Saffron organisations" after they found that he had converted to Islam from Hinduism. The group attempted to convince him to return to his previous faith. A later night, some local politicians visited his house to convince him to perform a 'ghar wapsi' (return to his 'home/ original faith'). On seeing them approach, he tried to flee in his vehicle, which is when he was intercepted and beaten, and was later hospitalised.

Nazir Ahmed, owner of a farmhouse in Bannerghatta, and his two sons, Mohammed Masi and Fateh, were wrongly detained by the police on charges of slaughtering a cow. Five to six men barged into the farmhouse Wednesday and harassed them. Outside the station, more than 20 gau rakshaks, who had lodged a complaint with the police, gathered to protest. The mob allegedly beat up Fateh who was trying to record a video of the mob harrassing the family. It was later found that two oxen had been slaughtered and not cows.

A low-intensity bomb allegedly thrown at a Muharram procession triggered communal clashes at Hazinagar and Halisahar, leaving several people injured while an estimated 30 homes and several shops, apart from four vehicles, have been ransacked or set on fire. Police said the situation is under control but many people have fled their homes.

A hotel owner alleged that Bajrang Dal activists, accompanied by the police, barged into his house and forcibly took away a calf he was rearing to the Moodbidri police station, accusing him of harbouring the animal to butcher it. Mohammed Shakir (42), who runs Bismillah Hotel at Beluvai, said that he was rearing the calf for the past eight months at his house. He had purchased it from someone in the village by paying Rs 2,000 to feed it leftover food from the hotel, which angered Bajrang Dal activists.

Faisal Pullani (earlier Aneesh Kumar), who worked as a driver in Saudi Arabia, was hacked to death after he converted to Islam. His family claimed that he had received threats from other family members over his conversion. The police arrested 12 people, including his brother-in-law K Vinod, a VHP member, in connection with the murder.

A Hindu mob went on a rampage attacking Muslim houses, shops and religious places during a 19-year-old Bajrang Dal activist's funeral. Deepak Kushwaha, the activist, was stabbed to death; a Hindu is among the 13 people arrested for his murder. The arson coincided with a bandh that Hindu organisations had called to protest Deepak's murder. The situation went out of control despite the presence of security personnel. Several houses had been torched while many Muslim residents had fled by the time curfew was imposed.
Hindu group attacked a Christian function in Sriganganagar.

A group of Christians returning home after singing Christmas Carols, was attacked by a group of 8 to 10 boys on bikes whose faces were covered. As per their complaint, the boys just yelled 'Bharat Mata ki Jai', attacked them and fled. The victims did not have any visible injuries, as per the police.

The Church of Jesus organised an event at a marriage hall in Royal Saraswati Garden, but right-wing groups gathered at the spot and began protesting before the function could begin. They were accusing the Christian community of carrying out religious conversion. As per the owner of the venue, the extremists also closed off the venue from the outside so as to intimidate the victims even more.
location: Marriage Hall in Royal Saraswati Garden

description_of_incident: On Christmas eve, armed men injured a group of 8 Christians including two women, allegedly because they were playing their hymns and songs too loudly on the loudspeaker, next to a temple. One of the Christian devotees alleged that there were 30-40 attackers, carrying sticks, rods and stones.

A false complaint as lodged against a Christian Pastor, alleging he was carrying out forceful conversions, reportedly to intimidate him to leave his faith. When he reached the police Station, he was told to come the next morning because the complainants had left by then. When he was returning, 9-10 people came on bikes and fired in the air saying "Jo apne dharam ka nahi hua, wo kisi ka nahi [One who could not be loyal to his faith, can't be loyal to anybody]".

Tribal Muslims living were accused of slaughtering a cow. Hearing this, a mob of more than 500 persons led by Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh activists entered the village with sticks and country-made rifles and fired on the people which, led to five injuries including to a minor girl.

Posters have surfaced in the village asking all Muslims to leave by year end or face "dire consequences". The posters--signed "all Hindus of the village"--say "with BJP in power in Uttar Pradesh Hindus of the village would do what US president Trump was doing to Muslims in that country".

A mob of more than 100 'self-style' Gau rakshaks protested and lay seige to hotel Hayat Rabbani in Jaipur over allegations that it serves beef. Chants of 'Bharat Mata ki Jai' and 'Narendra Modi Zindabad' were heard.

Villagers lynched a cow thief, Nasir, in Amroha district of Uttar Pradesh even as three other thieves managed to escape after firing at the locals, injuring six of them. The residents chased the thieves and caught one of them and beat him to death before the police could reach the spot.
location: Kalka Wali Dagrauli village, Hasanpur area
fir_details: For attempt to murder, assault on women, and mischief by fire with intent to destroy house, under relevant sections of the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.
cross_fir_details: For rioting with a deadly weapon, uttering obscenities, voluntarily causing, and criminal intimidation

description_of_incident: Posters have surfaced in the village asking Muslims to stop using loudspeaker for azaan. The posters--signed "all Hindus of the village"--threaten that prayers would not be allowed if they dont comply.

After a Muslim sarpanch was chosen by mutual consensus, a 5,000-strong mob attacked the Muslim-dominated hamlet in the village, leaving two dead, several injured and many houses gutted. Valuables and foodgrain were also stolen, survivors said. Initial reports suggested that the clash was triggered by a minor scuffle between two students, but a fact-finding committe report found the attack to have been planned.

Pehlu Khan and four others, including his two sons, were beaten by villagers who suspected that they were smuggling cows. Sixteen persons were allegedly transporting 36 bovine animals illegally in six pick-up vans. They were on their way to Haryana from Jaipur when the vigilantes stopped two of the vans in Behror on the Jaipur-Delhi National Highway. The men in the vans were thrashed and their vans damaged.

Jammu's Chamber of Commerce and Industries has issued a 10-day ultimatum to the state government and threatened to "identify and kill" Rohingya Muslims if they were not deported soon. The group demanded that the government book people renting out their properties to the refugees under a law that allows detention without trial for six months.

A house was attacked where a cow was allegedly slaughtered on the eve of Easter. Ernakulam rural police have registered a case against 14 BJP and RSS workers, following a complaint from a person named Kallarackal Jose of Karumallor.
was_affiliated_with_org: Bharatiya Janata Party, Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh

description_of_incident: A mob of 200 people attacked three nomadic Bakerwal families on the suspicion that they were cattle smugglers. While earlier reports had said the attackers were allegedly Vishwa Hindu Parishad and Bajrang Dal activists, the police said the affiliation of the arrested people with any organisation was to be ascertained.

A group of 10-12 people allegedly attacked Rizwan, Kamil and Ashu, who were transporting 14 buffaloes in a truck in south Delhi. Delhi police said the three men were transporting the animals for legal slaughter, but still arrested them under the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act. The three were later released on bail. Delhi police arrested a 32-year-old man, Shashank Sharma, and also arrested animal activist Gaurav Gupta in connection to the cow vigilante attack.
cross_fir_details: For assault and the transport of animals in an inhuman manner

description_of_incident: Two men were lynched by a mob following suspicion that they were trying to steal two cows from a village. Nagaon SP Debaraj Upadhyaya said Abu Hanifa, 23, and Riazuddin Ali, 24, were beaten after some villagers raised an alarm, alleging the two men had chased away two cows from the grazing ground in village Kasomari. They later died at the Jajari primary health centre.

Ghulam Mohammed, a 65-year-old Muslim man in a Bulandshahr village, was beaten to death over ties to an incident in the village over a week ago when a neighbour went missing, reportedly eloping with a girl. In his complaint to police, Mohammad's son Vakil Ahmad alleged that his father was beaten to death by members of the Hindu Yuva Vahini, founded by Yogi Adityanath, now the UP Chief Minister. He claimed that his uncle, Islam Khan, saw Mohammad being forced on to a bike by "seven or eight men wearing saffron gamchhas (towels) around their heads".
A group of about 100 men vandalised a newly constructed church. The mob is said to have threatened a person connected to the church and snatched his phone. No injuries were reported.
fir_details: Under IPC Sections 448 (punishment for house trespass), 427 (causing damage), 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 506 (criminal intimidation), 153 (giving provocation with intent to cause riot) and 149

description_of_incident: Two meat traders were beaten by a group of cow vigilantes on the suspicion that the former were carrying beef. A video of the attacks shows the men demand that the former say 'Jai Shri Ram'.

Villagers allegedly tied a 20-year-old Muslim man to a tree and beat him for hours for being in love with a Hindu woman, leading to his death. The man--identified as Mohammad Shalik, a resident of Raza Colony--was allegedly in a relationship with a Hindu woman of a nearby village, Soso, for more than a year. The girl reportedly called the boy to meet her at Gumla town for the Ram Navami procession. Fearing trouble, Shalik initially refused but finally went to meet her on a scooty and dropped her home, police said. It is then that a group of neighbours saw Shalik and attacked him.

A pregnant Muslim woman was stabbed and burnt alive, for marrying a Dalit man. Banu Begum (21) and Sayabanna Sharanappa Konnur (24) married against their families' wishes. Sayabanna was beaten, and escaped to seek police help. When he returned, he found Banu set on fire.

35-year-old Ainul Ansari was attacked by about 20 men for allegedly carrying beef for an Iftar party. Attackers informed the police and forced the latter to check the meat. Family claims it was mutton and not beef.

A group of villagers razed a newly constructed mosque to the ground. The villagers alleged that the mosque--on a plot own by one Akbar Ali--was being funded from Pakistan/Qatar, and that temple stood in its place earlier.
fir_details: For house trespass, Mischief causing damage to the amount of Rs 50

description_of_incident: Basit Malik, a reporter investigating the destruction of a mosque, was beaten by a gathering of Hindu residents whom he was speaking to. Malik, a Kashmir Muslim, was attacked for 90 minutes before the police were called and he was handed over.

Two men were caught allegedly trying to steal buffaloes. A mob of about 50 men tied them to a tree and beat the men. They were later paraded, and were handed over to the police. Police said the men--Asif and Rehan--were hardened criminals, and had fired at the villagers first.
cross_fir_details: Under Sections 147 (rioting), 148 (rioting, armed with deadly weapons), 149 (unlawful assembly for an offense committed in prosecution of common object), 307 (attempted murder), 379 (theft) and 411 (dishonestly receiving stolen property) of the IPC

description_of_incident: A cleric--70-year-old Mohammed Younus--was shot dead by "unknown assailants", after he apprehended them in the act of throwing meat at a mosque where he worked.

Muslim teenager Junaid Khan was stabbed to death and four others from his family were injured on board a Mathura-bound train, when an argument over a seat turned into religious slurs and triggered a mob attack on family members returning home from Eid shopping.

A Muslim dairy trader was beaten and his house set on fire after a dead cow was found outside his house. A 100-strong mob had gathered, which swelled to 1,000, and 50 policemen were injured in stone pelting. One person was shot in the leg in police firing.

A Muslim journalist, NDTV's Munne Bharti, travelling with his family on NH-28 in Bihar was asked by Bajrang Dal activists to say "Jai Shri Ram" or they'd set fire to his car. The family was dressed in attire indicative of their faith. They did as asked in fear and were allowed to leave.

A mob of more than 100 men beat Alimuddin aka Asgar Ali to death on suspicion of carrying beef. Police said he was walking before he was shifted to a hospital, but he died in the hospital. Eleven persons were sentenced to life imprisonment for the lynching.
Anees Khan, a Kashmiri student studying in Chaudhary Charan Singh University, was beaten up and by masked men because he was "a Muslim and Kashmiri".

Angry Muslim mobs set fire to shops and houses belonging to Hindus in Baduria, Swarupnagar and Taki blocks of West Bengal's North 24 Paraganas district after a class 11 student posted a blasphemous message on Facebook. The Hindu student was arrested but vandalism continued for two days. One person died of stab wounds.

An interfaith couple, Suhail and Monika were manhandled outside the sub-divisional magistrate court when they had gone to get their marriage certificate verified. The attackers were allegedly BJP workers. It was later revealed that one of the perpetrators, Jaswinder Kaur is the BJP district-vice president.
fir_details: Police registered an FIR for rioting, voluntarily causing hurt, intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of peace and criminal intimidation against Neeraj Bishnoi, Jaswinder Kaur and 10-12 unidentified people

description_of_incident: The homes of two dozen Muslim families were torched in Madhya Pradesh after a youth from the community eloped with a minor Rajput girl. “If you don’t hand over the man and our girl within two hours, we will set every house on fire. If you don’t leave the village after that and try to intervene, no one will be spared,’’ a section of Hindu villagers had allegedly warned Muslims before torching almost every property owned by the minority community.

Bajrang Dal activists protesting the terror attack on Amarnath pilgrims allegedly asked a Muslim man to shout "Bharat Mata ki Jai". Following a verbal argument, an unidentified person slapped the Muslim man.

A 36-year-old Muslim man, Ismail Shah, was beaten by cow protectors who accused him of carrying beef. The Nagpur police have arrested four men for the assault. Shah kept telling them it was goat meat and not beef but the men wouldn't listen to him.
After a Hindu-Muslim couple Naseem Khan and Pinki Kumari returned to their village--two years after getting married--Naseem was beaten with sticks and shot to death by Pinki's family.

A man undergoing treatment for mental illness was tied to a tree and beaten up over an alleged attempt to steal cattle. Police said no FIR has been registered as there was no complaint from either side. According to police, Mohammad Afroz, who is in his mid-20s and is a resident of Wasseypur in Dhanbad, was in Dharjori. When he saw some cows grazing, he started shepherding three of them, triggering suspicion among villagers, said police.
Samajwadi Party MLA Abu Azmi's son Farhan received death threats for marrying a Hindu woman. The caller also allegedly made remarks against the Muslim community and threatened to bomb Azmi's house.

Three Muslim men were beaten by a group of cow vigilantes over suspicion of transporting beef in a truck. The mob also blocked a highway alleging that the police was involved in illegal beef transport to West Bengal. Tensions quelled after the three Muslim men were arrested.
cross_fir_details: For illegal transportation and smuggling of beef

description_of_incident: Mohammad Yaqeen, the principal of a govt junior college, was heckled and beaten by villagers and student activists after unfurling the national flag during Independence Day celebrations--for not taking off his shoes. Yaqeen was forced to say "Jai Shri Ram" and "Bharat Mata Ki Jai".

Six Muslim men were beaten on suspicion of slaughtering a calf. When the husband of the village head tried to intervene, he was beaten as well. A case was filed against the seven men who were attacked for animal cruelty and "hurting religious sentiments".
cross_fir_details: For animal cruelty and hurting religious sentiments

description_of_incident: A mob of about 100 men attacked several people and vandalised houses after a cow's carcass was spotted in the village. They also ransacked two mosques.
fir_details: Under IPC sections 147, 148, 149 (rioting), 395 (dacoity) and 295 (injuring or defiling place of worship)
cross_fir_details: Under UP Prevention of Cow Slaughter Act

description_of_incident: A Muslim man was assaulted on allegations of cattle smuggling. Lal Hussain had purchased a cow on Friday from a villager and was on his way to hand over the cow to another person to whom he had sold in a nearby village, when one Kuldeep Raj and others attacked him, thinking he was smuggling cattle.

Hafizul Sheikh of Dhubri district in Assam and Anwar Hussain of Patlakhawa village of Cooch Behar district were beaten to death by locals at the Dadon II gram panchayat area in Jalpaiguri's Dhupguri block on suspicion of cow theft.

Six Rohingya Muslim refugees staying in a slum were beaten by locals. Forty refugee families pooled in money to buy two buffalo calves for sacrifice for Eid. Locals first accused the refugees of having stolen the animals. On producing proof of purchase, they offered to buy the calves. Later in the evening, two more men came to the slum cluster and told them not to sacrifice the animals. Anticipating danger, the refugee families promised to return the animals the next morning. But around two dozen men, some of them on motorcycles, reached the settlement around 5 a.m. They abducted four men and beat them with lathis. Two women were also allegedly molested and their clothes torn off.
fir_details: Under Sections 341, 307, 323 and 147 of the RPC

description_of_incident: Two people, including a woman, were injured when a mob attacked a family and set fire to their house for allegedly slaughtering a bovine animal. The police claimed to have recovered bovine meat and other evidence suggesting that the animal was slaughtered. They added that some people noticed meat pieces and head of the animal at a place adjacent to the house of Mian, a labourer. Word soon spread that the animal was slaughtered apparently for meat to be distributed during Eid-ul-Azha, which was when the mob gathered and began thrashing Mian’s kin while he managed to escape sensing trouble.

Hindus in an unauthorised settlement on the Araria-Raniganj road said their Muslim neighbours had sacrificed a cow for Eid ul-Adha. Police were called and they confiscated several pieces of meat from one of the huts and sent it for analysis. By then, a crowd had gathered, which was dispersed at after heavy police deployment. The crowd re-appeared with one waving a Bajrang Dal flag, demanding the accused be handed over to them for punishment.

Communal tensions rose after two men were accused of cow slaughter. A local representative said Bajrang Dal activists and BJP workers were about to set the men's house on fire. Both men were arrested for cow slaughter.

A Hindu-Muslim couple approached the Bombay High Court alleging harassment by Bajrang Dal activists and Nagpur police. Mohammad Arif Dosani, a resident of Vasmath in Hingoli district, and Monica Ingle, now Aayat after conversion, said police officers from Imamwada police station constantly harassed them at the instance of Bajrang Dal men. Arif's relatives were also harassed, it was alleged.

Sangeeta Varshney, BJP Mahila Morcha's president was caught on camera repeatedly slapping and repimanding a girl for being in a relationship with a Muslim man. It is claimed that the couple was also rounded up by Hindu Yuva Vahini.
was_affiliated_with_org: BJP Mahila Morcha, Hindu Yuva Vahini
cross_fir_details: The Muslim man was booked on charges of obscenity.

description_of_incident: An interfaith couple--Saddam, 25, and Krishna, 21--was stopped from registering their marriage by Bajrang Dal workers, who also tried to attack Saddam. The workers were lathicharged when they turned on the policemen trying to protect the couple.

A Muslim folk singer Ahmad Khan was killed allegedly by a Hindu priest and his two friends, after they accused Khan of making mistakes while reciting hymns to evoke a Hindu goddess. The murder led to 20-odd Muslim families leaving the village, who have refused to come back.

A mob vandalised a room inside a mosque and abused and slapped an Imam and his brother. The mob had allegedly more than 100 persons. They were pelting stones, slapped the two and called the victims 'terrorists' repeatedly.
A Muslim man was dragged out of a hotel and assaulted for being with a Hindu woman--allegedly by her relatives.
Five Muslim men were beaten by cow vigilantes on suspicion of transporting beef. As the meat turned out to be that of buffalo's, police booked a case against attackers.
fir_details: Under Sections 148, 149, 323, 341, and 506 of the Indian Penal Code
cross_fir_details: Under laws related to cow slaughter

description_of_incident: A Hindu girl--wife of a Muslim--was raped by her father-in-law and an uncle of the husband, and then killed because she refused to convert to Islam post her marriage. The dead body of the victim, who had gone missing since a number of days, was recovered with her hands and legs tied, near the bank of a river. The husband alleged that he too was tied up by his father-uncle duo, and hence wasn't able to stop them.

The body of Umar Khan was found on railway tracks in Rajasthan's Alwar district. His family says he had been killed by cow vigilantes. Two others were also shot at, and two accused have been arrested.
fir_details: Under IPC section 302 (murder) and 201 (causing disappearance of evidence of offence)

description_of_incident: Three Muslim clerics were assaulted on a moving train at night, when they were returning to their village in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat from Delhi. "Why do you wear a rumaal (scarf)," one of their attackers allegedly shouted. The three, who teach at a madrasa, say around 11 pm, they were preparing to get off at their destination when six men in their coach bolted the exits and started beating them, even using an iron rod used as an icepick.
Two class IX students--Mukesh Kumar and Noor Jehan Khatun--were killed allegedly by Noor Jehan's family, as the teenagers fell in love.

A Muslim labourer Mohammad Afrazul was hacked to death and his body was burned--while the incident was videotaped by the perpetrator's nephew. When the victim falls silent, Shambhu Lal looks into the camera and launches into a hate speech, declaring that he killed to save a woman from "love jihad".
The body of Paresh Mesta, a right wing activist, was found in a lake. Mesta's father alleged the former died as a result of communal clashes.
A Muslim man was beaten by 8-10 men for "getting a woman from a different community" to his house. The men alleged that the two were involved in "indecent activities".
cross_fir_details: Under SC Act and for molestation

description_of_incident: More than 30 priests were detained after Bajrang Dal activists complained that the former were involved in forced conversion. The priests alleged that the activists beat them on the premises of the police station. One Dharmendra Dohad had filed a complaint that he was offered money for forced conversion.
cross_fir_details: Under Freedom of Religion Act and Sections 153-B and 295-A of the IPC

description_of_incident: 23-year-old Reshma Ashok Kumar Kunil was kidnapped, allegedly by her own family, as the latter did not approve of her marriage to Mohammed Iqbal Mohammed Umar Chaudhary, 28, a resident of Mankhurd. Chaudhary filed a habeas corpus petition in the Bombay High Court on December 22, and one person was arrested. On February 7, 2018, the couple was reunited as the court allowed Reshma to live with Chaudhary.

A tribal Sarna couple and their elder daughter was lynched, while two younger daughters were injured. One of the injured girls, a 17-year-old, is said to have had an affair with a Christian youth Nandlal Kerketta, 23. The girl's family had filed charges of abduction on Nandlal following which he jumped into a well while fleeing from the police.
The Hindu Jagran Manch has warned the management of all Aligarh schools against celebrating Christmas and threatened, if they did so, it would be "at their own risk".

Communal tensions rose in Belagavi after stones were pelted at an Ayyappa Swami pooja pandal. Muslims of the area say the trouble began when some Hindus fired crackers and rockets on Muslim houses in the guise of celebrating the BJP's victory in Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh. Some groups claim that when a dispute arose over the erection of barricading for Swami Ayyappa Pooja pandal, the quarrel arose which turned into stone pelting.

Organisers of a Christmas event alleged that Hindu group such as the Shiv Sena and Vishwa Hindu Parishad disrupted a Christmas event and manhandled some of the organisers. Police said the event was being conducted without permission, and that they had received a tip-off about religious conversions. Shiv Sena denied involvement in the attack.

An idol of Lord Hanuman was removed from government pasture land by district authorities. Suspecting that this was done by Muslims, Hindu groups took out a rally in the area. Stone-pelting followed between the communities.

A cow smuggler named Zakir Khan (46) was thrashed by the villagers after he was caught with a truck carrying eight cows. He sustained a head injury and a fractured foot. At first, the police rushed him to a hospital in Ramgarh, but given the seriousness of the injuries, he was later referred to another hospital in Alwar city.
cross_fir_details: For cow smuggling, firing at police

description_of_incident: A mob comprising local BJP leaders and members of right wing groups gathered outside the venue of a Hindu-Muslim wedding. The bride's father, a Hindu, said he had been receiving threatening calls saying he was acting against the Hindu religion.
fir_details: Under IPC section 147 (rioting), 342 (wrongful confinement), 504 (intentional insult to provoke breach of peace), 452 (trespassing) and 507 (criminal intimidation)

description_of_incident: The family of a 14-year-old girl who was allegedly molested by a Muslim youth Arif Ghanchi reached Arif's house. On not finding him there, Arif's mother alleged, the family broke furniture and beat her up.

Arif Ghanchi, accused of molesting a 14-year-old Hindu girl--was confronted by the girl's cousin. Later, Ghanchi and his accomplices Bilal Chauhan and Taufiq Chauhan attacked the cousin and his friends with wooden logs.
The headmaster of a primary school was suspended following complaints that he beat up students for joining hands for prayer and Vande Matram.

A Muslim tutor was accused of harassing a minor Hindu girl. The tutor and his 19-year-old daughter were beaten up by a mob led by the family of the girl. The tutor's other students claim he is innocent, and that the case was being filed to raise communal tension--by the girl's grandfather who worked for the BJP.

61-year-old Mohammed Farooq was found dead in a pool of blood inside a mosque where he worked as a muezzin. Cigarette butts and signs of urination on the floor suggest the motive of communal polarisation, according to a representative of a Muslim rights' group
A Muslim youth, Wasim Ansari (19) was beaten to death after he approached a group of people to lower the volume of music on New Year's Day.

Two college girls were beaten up by a group of men, allegedly belonging to a Hindu right-wing organisation, for being with Muslim boys at a zoo. One of girls was continued to be assaulted even after a police constable intervened.
Deepak Rao, a member of the Bajrang Dal, was murdered following a dispute over tying of buntings for a festival.
Forty-seven-year-old Abdul Basheer died after he was attacked--as a member of the community in retaliation for the murder of Bajrang Dal activist Deepak Rao.
Muslim leaders were forced to stand up for Vande Mataram by Bajrang Dal activists. The former cited religious reasons for not standing, but complied later and refused to sing along.

An 8 year-old-girl belonging to a nomadic community was raped and murdered by a group of men, in order to drive this community out of the area. As per the chargesheet filed by the police, the assailants seem to have first fed her sedatives forcefully, and continued to do so over the 4 days that they held her in captivity.
fir_details: Under Sections 302 (murder), 376 (rape), 201 (destruction of evidence) and 120-B (criminal conspiracy) of the Indian Penal Code.

description_of_incident: Seven Muslim men stabbed a Hindu man, Dharmendra, following an argument about burning hay kept for stray cattle.

Following an attack on a Hindu man, Dharmendra, scores of people from both Muslim and Hindu communities clashed. Police resorted to firing in the air to disperse the crowds. A sub-divisional magistrate was injured in the ruckus, and policemen were injured when stones were pelted at them.

Three Muslim men--Kaleem, Nadeem and Mudasar--who had come to UP's Baghpat tehsil from Barnala district in Punjab with a 24-year-old Hindu woman, were allegedly assaulted by Vishwa Hindu Parishad workers, on allegations of conversion. The woman told police that she left Barnala to get married to Kaleem.
fir_details: For rioting and voluntarily causing hurt

description_of_incident: A group of Muslims were beaten and their vehicles damaged after members of the Vishwa Hindu Parishad attacked them following the mysterious disappearance of VHP international president Pravin Togadia.

Two Muslim men who bought cows were harassed and beaten by members of a right-wing Hindu organisation. Those who sold the cow were also harassed. Following this, the local Muslim councillor (Abdul Gaffar Khan) handed over his cow to the local police station.

The body of a Christian pastor was found--in a kneeling position, with a rope around the neck tied to the roof of the hut. An associate alleged that this was a murder committed by members of right wing organisations which were threatening the pastor some months before.
party_in_power: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam

description_of_incident: On Republic Day, a Hindu group was taking out an unauthorised 'Tiranga Yatra', and demanded that a group of Muslims who gathered to hoist the national flag clear the way for them. When the latter resisted, there was some "pushing and shoving" following which the Hindu group left.

A Hindu group that was taking out an unauthorised 'Tiranga Yatra' regrouped in a Muslim majority area, where residents thought they came to retaliate to earlier clashes during a Republic Day celebration. Clashes ensued, and 28-year-old Chandan Gupta was shot dead.

A day after a man was killed and another injured in a communal clash, a mob set ablaze about 10 shops, vehicles and a makeshift house. A top police officer said violence started around 11 am, about an hour after Chandan Gupta, who was killed in firing between two groups during an unauthorised rally to mark Republic Day on Friday, was cremated. This latest attack was carried out in retaliation to Gupta's death, police said, and most of the property targeted, including cars and shops, were owned by members of the minority community.

A 23-year-old Hindu man, Ankit Saxena, was killed allegedly by the members of one Shehzadi's family who were opposed to the couple's interfaith relationship. When Ankit's mother tried to shield him, she was beaten.

A 45-year-old Muslim man was beaten and forced to say 'Jai Shri Ram'. The assailant, Vijay Kumar Meena, who recorded the incident himself, later said he was ashamed of his actions, and that he was under the influence of alcohol.

A 19-year-old Muslim boy and a 17-year-old Hindu girl--on a Valentine's Day date--were caught by some members of the Vishwa Hindu Parishad who termed it as an incident of "love jihad". The boy was beaten, and handed over to his parents.

A Muslim youth, 22-year-old Aqib Qazi, was beaten and his motorcycle set on fire after the neighbours of a Hindu girl he was visiting and members of a right wing outfit were irked by it. When the girl's family tried to stop the attackers, they were beaten too.
fir_details: Under IPC sections 147 (punishment for rioting) 149 (every member of unlawfully assembly guilty of offence) 354-A (sexual assault) and under POCSO Act.

description_of_incident: At least 20 Christians including a priest were attacked on allegations of forced conversion--by alleged right wingers--when they were on their way in a bus to a congregation. A woman in the bus reportedly told the man she was sitting next to her that she was converted forcibly, following which he informed people who arrived at the bus stand and attacked them.

A Muslim man, 32-year-old Farnaz Saiyed, died and his mother Roshanbiwi Syed was injured after they "disobeyed the orders to stay indoors". Activists of the Bajrang Dal attacked the mother-son duo when the latter were out grazing their cattle. Roshanbiwi's fingers were chopped while Farnaz was hit on the head.

Two men--Noorul Amin, 40, and Guran Pote, 35--were transporting cattle when they were waylaid and beaten by right-wing activists, for alleged trafficking. The victims said there were about 100 persons in the group which assaulted them and also damaged the vehicle.
fir_details: Under the Section 307 (attempt to murder) of Indian Penal Code
cross_fir_details: For illegal transport transport of cattle under the provisions of Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act

description_of_incident: A mob of nearly 60 people attacked a Catholic hospital, abused lady staff and nuns and physically assaulted them. The Catholic Bishops' Conference of India alleged that the attackers were enjoying political and financial clout. They also blamed the police for inaction.
location: Pushap Mission Hospital and Maternity Home, Ujjain

description_of_incident: Communal violence broke out when members belonging to the RSS, BJP and Bajrang Dal tried to take out a procession without seeking appropriate permission. More than 35 people were reported injured in Bhagalpur. Policemen also sustained injuries while trying to deal with rioters. Several shops and vehicles were set on fire. Union Minister Ashwini Choubey's son Arijit Shashwat was later booked for inciting violence.

Communal clashes broke out during Ram Navami procession. The two communities resorted to stone-pelting injuring several people on each side. Three to five vehicles were reportedly set afire. Later, police arrested six persons.

When a Ram Navami rally passed through a Muslim area without permission, the local leader and police tried to intervene and bring them back to the planned route. Meanwhile, some bikes belonging to the rallyists were burnt which sparked clashes. 50-year-old Shahjahan was killed when he was relieving himself near a pond. Shahjahan was beaten with iron rods and sticks from behind. Some policemen were also injured.

Stones were pelted at a Ram Navmi procession, following which the city reported communal clashes for two days. At least 50 shops were gutted and over two dozen people were injured. Police arrested nearly 125 people, suspended internet services and imposed curfew in the town.

Trouble started after Muslims protested playing of "an objectionable song" and shouting of inflammatory slogans by a group leading an idol immersion procession on the occasion of Chaiti Durga Puja. The fiery exchange of words gave way to physical fights followed by stone-pelting. Soon gun shots were also fired from both sides. Tension spread to several parts of Munger where vehicles were set on fire and property damaged by rioters.

Clashes erupted after a slipper was hurled at a procession carrying the idol of Goddess Durga for immersion. A mosque was vandalised. Some people tried to hoist a saffron flag on the top of the minarets of the mosque. Curfew was imposed in Samastipur while at least 10 people including an IPS officer were injured. Vehicles were set on fire by rioters.

Following violence triggered by Ram Navami processions, a 16-year-old was beaten to death after he was picked up outside his home by a mob. The body of Sibtulla Rashidi, who appeared for his Class X board exams this year, was recovered later and identified the next day.

Communal conflict erupted over the route of a Ram Navami procession. Both sides resorted to stone-pelting. Police used mild force before firing tear gas shells to disperse rioters. A policeman was among around two dozen people who sustained injuries during clashes. Around 15 persons were taken into custody for rioting.

Clashes broke out over the route for Ram Navami procession. Those leading the procession first clashed with the police who rejected their demand to take a route than what was earlier permitted. Police resorted to batoncharge and a case was registered.

Members of two communities clashed following reports of desecration of an idol. Scores of vehicles were damaged on the National Highway 31. A hotel was also set on fire by the rioters. Police were reported to fire at least 10 rounds in air to bring situation under control. Journalists covering the clashes were roughed up by rioters.

A few right-wing groups, and the local traders' body vandalised upto 15 shops owned by Muslim traders, after a fake video was shared on social media along with statements alleging that a 10-year-old Hindu girl had been raped by a Muslim man in the town. Atleast 2,000 persons gathered near the police station demanding justice for the alleged rape victim.
fir_details: For vandalism and for spreading the fake video

description_of_incident: A man was injured when a mob allegedly assaulted him over suspicion of serving bovine meat at his son's wedding reception. The mob also vandalised his house. A mike from a neighbouring worship place was also damaged. The mob pelted stones and damaged several bikes, three four-wheelers and two autorickshaws parked in the street. A few other houses, neighbouring that of the victim, were also vandalised.
Two Christian pastors were manhandled by a group of miscreants in a temple, following a pamphlet distributed by the former against the Centre.
fir_details: Under 153 A (Promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race, etc., and doing acts prejudicial to maintenance of harmony) and section 342 of IPC (punishment for wrongful confinement).
party_in_power: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam

description_of_incident: A Dalit man was slapped and harassed for converting to Islam, allegedly by Bajrang Dal activists. 25-year-old Pawan Kumar had varying statements to give to the media: One, that he was afraid to speak to the police, and that he had converted to Islam because of the ill-treatment by upper castes. Two, that he had not converted to Islam, and started sporting a beard and a skull cap because he liked it.

A 21-year-old Muslim man was killed for having an affair with a Hindu woman. The man was first abducted by the woman's kin and was later found by a waste-water pond--his legs were beaten to a pulp, and there were severe injuries to his head and torso. He died in the hospital a few hours later.
fir_details: For murder, abduction for murder, wrongful restraint, voluntarily causing hurt, eliminating evidence, and rioting

description_of_incident: A Muslim labourer was beaten on a train, after he could not name the Prime Minister and the West Bengal chief minister. Reports say four youth attacked Jamal Momin after they learnt he was Muslim.
Two Muslim men were beaten for allegedly carrying beef and suspected cow slaughter. While 45-year-old Riyaz succumbed to his injuries in a hospital, 35-year-old Shakil sustained major injuries.
A 24-year-old Muslim man was abused, threatened and assaulted by a group of men--reportedly belonging to right wing organisations--who objected to his relationship with a Hindu woman

VHP workers beat up 2 Muslim youth, who were spotted with a Hindu girl, sitting by the Kosi river. The area where they youth were found was inside the premises of a temple, which VHP workers had complained, had become a "picnic spot", and that couples would keep coming there.

Around 20 Muslim families were forced to flee their homes after a mob attacked their homes around Iftar and assaulted several people including women. The mob also ransacked the mosque and assaulted the Muslims who were offering Maghrib prayer there. According to the victims, the attackers were armed with swords, axes and lathi.

A 61-year-old cattle trader was killed while transporting cows. The man's relatives allefed that Bajrang Dal activists stopped his car and killed him. Police said they were pursuing a vehicle in which the victim was travelling--allegedly illegally transporting cattle--when it skid off the road and occupants fled in all directions. The victim's body was later found, police said.
A group of Muslims were thrashed for reciting Azaan, and were stopped from doing it. Victims said that some persons attacked them and also damaged the sound system.
fir_details: Under the provisions 295, 323, and 506 of IPC.

description_of_incident: Two Muslim clerics were assaulted for their refusal to say 'Jai Shri Ram'. As per a local human rights lawyer, when they were travelling back from offering prayers and heading to their village, 20-odd people aboard an SUV stopped them, and asked them to chant Jai Shri Ram. When they refused to do so, they were assaulted with lathis and hockey sticks. While one of them was able to flee, the other sustained major injuries.

Two Muslim Men--Sirabuddin Ansari (35) and Murtaza Ansari (30)--were lynched for alleged theft of 13 buffaloes. While five people were accused of the act, three managed to flee, and two were caught by a mob, and beaten to death.

Two men were attacked on cow slaughter rumours. While Qasim, 45, died, Shamiuddin sustained major injuries. A video of the attack was shot and uploaded on social media. Police however said the attack was a result of a motorbike-related scuffle.
fir_details: For murder, attempt to murder and rioting

description_of_incident: A Christian pastor was thrashed inside the court premises by Bajrang Dal activists for trying to convert 11 people. The pastor was later arrested under section 151 of CRPC (Arrest to prevent the commission of cognizable offence).
cross_fir_details: Under Provision 151 of CRPC (Arrest to Prevent Commission of Cognizable Offence)

description_of_incident: A Dalit man was beaten by his Muslim-in-laws a year after the couple got married. The man is reported to have been attacked with wooden sticks. The wife sought arrest of her kin.
fir_details: Under Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities Act)

description_of_incident: Members of a Sikh organisation protest, the Sikh Youth Sewa Trust, against an alleged attack on a Sikh girl n Kashmir. A video of the girl, a student of the Islamic University of Science and Technology, narrating her ordeal has also gone viral on social media. The girl, a resident of Gandhpora Tral, in the video, claimed that she was attacked by two men riding a motorcycle with a sharp-edged weapon on July 2 when she was going to the university. She said she suffered injuries to her arm and alleged that no action was taken against the culprits even after an FIR was registered the next day.

A Dalit man was beaten to death for having an affair with two Muslim women. Khetaram Bheel rented a piece of land from one Aasiyat Khan. Bheel is said to have had an affair with the woman's youngest daughter and another daughter--wife of Amar Khan, the prime accused in his murder case.

Rakbar Khan, a Muslim man in his thirties, was beaten to death by a mob on suspicion of cow smuggling. Khan, a resident of Kol Gaon village in Ferozepur Jhirka tehsil of Mewat district in Haryana, had two cows with him when he was attacked. An unidentified man with him escaped.
location: Lalawandi village, Ramgarh Police Station Area

description_of_incident: A Muslim man was thrashed by six Hindu men while the former was on his way to register his marriage with a Hindu girl. The mob thrashed him, held him by the collar and paraded him in the court premises before the police on the premises rescued him. A taxi hired by the couple to reach the court was also damaged by the angry mob. Two men have sought to surrender for the attack.

Displeased at the marriage of an interfaith couple, the Muslim woman's family and others from her community--about 200 people--ransacked the Hindu man's house, set ablaze his father's multi-utility vehicle and a neighbour's moped, and stole ornaments worth Rs 45,000. The complainant alleged that the mob was armed with sticks and sharp weapons.
fir_details: For dacoity, rioting, arson and trespassing

description_of_incident: Jawaharlal Nehru University student Umar Khalid was shot at outside the Constitution Club of India in Delhi. Khalid, who was to address an event at the Club, escaped unhurt. A day after the incident, the alleged shooters, in a video uploaded on social media, claimed that the attack was an “Independence Day gift” to the nation and appealed to the police not to “harass” others for the attack.
fir_details: The Delhi police have registered a case under Section 307 (attempt to murder) of the IPC and Arms Act at Parliament Street police station.

description_of_incident: 50 year old Fakir Mohammed Syed was ferrying cattle when he was intercepted by 3 self-styled gau rakshaks and was assaulted. While he has been booked for ferrying livestock without permission under Cruelty to Animals Act, his assailants have been booked for assault and criminal intimidation.
fir_details: Booked for assault and criminal intimidation
cross_fir_details: Booked under Cruelty to Animals Act

description_of_incident: An unruly mob vandalised the house of a Muslim man at Titoli village over suspicion that he killed a cow on the occasion of Eid. Yamin Khokhar, his family and neighbouring Muslim families fled to save their lives before the mob armed with lathis also vandalised the namaaz ghar of the village. A calf hit Yamin’s niece on Wednesday when she was playing outside his house, leaving her injured, villagers said. “To shoo away the calf, Yamin hit it with a lathi. The calf walked a few steps and died on the corner of the road. But some anti-social elements spread the rumour that Muslims killed it for Bakrid. Yamin and his family fled the village apprehending trouble,” said Naseerudin, Yamin’s neighbour.
cross_fir_details: Yamin and his neighbours went to the police station for protection, but the police arrested him, his brother Yasin and his neighbour Shokeen and booked them under

description_of_incident: A mini-truck carrying animal remains was set ablaze  and its driver, Wasim Ahmad, was beaten up by a group of men on motorcycles.
fir_details: Booked for voluntarily causing hurt and mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy house.
